pages.name: About the order
pages.description: You can apply to the court for an order for contact with a child. The order will usually include details about how the contact will happen.

elements.name: childrenRequireContactChoices
elements.title: Select each child from the list below that you want an order for contact with.

elements.name: lastContactDate
elements.title: When did you last have contact with the {selectedChildWording}?
elements.description: If you do not remember the exact date, pick any date on or around the time you last remember having contact. If there is more than one child, pick the most recent date you had contact with any of the children.

elements.name: contactTypeChoices
elements.title: Tell the court and the other party what contact you are asking for.

elements.name: inPersonDetails
elements.title: Provide specific dates or events requested, or dates and times that would be most suitable for in person contact with the child(ren).

elements.name: changeInConditionsFAQ
elements.title:
Sometimes, the court or the other party may only consider it in the best interests of the child(ren) for there to be conditions on your contact with the child(ren). Conditions may include:
  • Supervised visits
  • Contact during specified times
  • Contact only in a specific location
  • Things a person has to do if they want contact with a child (for example, not use drugs or alcohol while with the child or not have guests over while the child is visiting)

choices.text: I am willing to have the conditions placed on my contact with the child(ren).
I do not want any conditions placed on my contact with the child(ren)

elements.name: conditionsDescription
elements.title: Describe the conditions you are willing to have on your contact with child(ren)
elements.description: If there are any conditions you are willing to have placed on your contact with the child(ren) be sure to include them in the space provided.

elements.name: newContactOrderChildBestInterestDescription
elements.title: I believe the order about contact I am applying for is in the child(ren)'s best interests because:
elements.description:
When you ask for a court order involving a child, you must consider what is in the best interest of the child(ren). Every family situation is unique and the court needs to know why you believe the order you are asking for is best for the child(ren).

To determine what is in the child's best interests when asking for contact with a child, you must consider factors including:
  • The child's emotional health and well-being
  • The child's views, unless it would be inappropriate to consider them
  • The child's relationships with parents, guardians, and other important people
  • The history of care, and
  • The impact of any family violence

You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about why you think the court should make the contact order.
